poem:
**Uncontrolled Power**

Under the guise of a handshake,  
a whisper of ownership  
crosses borders.  
Reactors pulse with silence,  
while the ground remembers  
the weight of new empires.  
A confusion of tongues,  
turning presidents into pawns;  
the sun still rises  
over fields,  
untouched by the shadows  
cast by the ambitions  
of men.
